curriculum_info.name_vi: Chương trình cử nhân ngành CNTT, chuyên ngành Kỹ thuật phần mềm
curriculum_info.name_en: The Bachelor Program of Information Technology, Software Engineering Major

general_objectives.vi: Đào tạo cử nhân ngành Công nghệ thông tin (CNTT) chuyên ngành Kỹ thuật phần mềm (KTPM) có nhân cách và năng lực đáp ứng nhu cầu thực tế của xã hội; nắm vững kiến thức chuyên môn và thực hành, có khả năng tổ chức, thực hiện và phát huy sáng tạo trong các công việc liên quan đến các chuyên ngành KTPM được đào tạo; có khả năng theo đuổi việc học tập, nghiên cứu ở bậc học cao hơn. Chương trình đào tạo chuyên ngành KTPM có định hướng ứng dụng.
general_objectives.en: To train bachelors in Information Technology, specializing in Software Engineering, with personality and capacity to meet the practical needs of society; to master professional and practical knowledge, to be able to organize, implement and promote creativity in jobs related to the specializations of Software Engineering being trained; to be able to pursue studies and research at higher levels. The training program in Software Engineering is application-oriented.

job_positions.vi: Lập trình viên phát triển ứng dụng
Chuyên viên phân tích nghiệp vụ
Kỹ sư đảm bảo chất lượng phần mềm
Kỹ sư quy trình sản xuất phần mềm
Quản trị viên dự án phần mềm

program_learning_outcomes.name: General Knowledge
program_learning_outcomes.description: Understand basic knowledge of social sciences, political law, national security and defense, contributing to the formation of a scientific worldview and methodology.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Professional Foundation
program_learning_outcomes.description: Apply solid scientific foundation knowledge in the field of information technology in general and software engineering in particular to understand the professional context and acquire in-depth specialized knowledge of software engineering.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Solution Proposal
program_learning_outcomes.description: Apply in-depth specialized knowledge, new technologies in the field of software engineering, or expanded knowledge (in fields close to software engineering) to work and propose solutions to meet diverse needs from reality.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Planning & Operation
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have basic knowledge of planning and operating, implementing, and supervising the implementation of plans for specialized work in the field of software engineering.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Entrepreneurship & Critical Thinking
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have a mindset about startups and apply startup knowledge and skills to implement a startup project; have creative thinking, research skills, critical thinking and problem solving.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Foreign Language
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have intermediate English proficiency equivalent to level 4 according to the 6-level foreign language competency framework for Vietnam, and be able to communicate simply in Japanese.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Communication
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have the ability to communicate and present to clearly state the problem to be solved and convey knowledge and skills when performing specific/complex professional tasks related to software engineering.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Technical Tools
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have the ability to program and use analysis, design, construction/implementation, and testing tools in the field of software engineering.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Advanced Techniques
program_learning_outcomes.description: Have the ability to update and exploit advanced tools and techniques in the field of software engineering in particular and information technology in general.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Teamwork & Lifelong Learning
program_learning_outcomes.description: Develop the ability to work independently as well as work effectively in a team in an academic and practical environment; take personal responsibility and responsibility for the team when performing a professional job. Have the spirit of self-study, lifelong learning, adapt to the continuous changes of technology and society.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Ethics & Responsibility
program_learning_outcomes.description: Behave professionally, ethically, socially responsible and have a spirit of serving the community; have professional responsibility and integrity in work.

program_learning_outcomes.name: National Identity
program_learning_outcomes.description: Be mentally and physically strong, demonstrate national identity, and be confident in international integration.

program_learning_outcomes.name: Project Management
program_learning_outcomes.description: Be able to plan, coordinate, and manage resources related to software engineering projects; guide and supervise the implementation of project tasks and at the same time, be able to evaluate the effectiveness of the project and propose feasible and effective solutions for improvement.

subjects.prerequisite: Students attained 90% of the total credits prior to the OJT term (excluding Physical Education and OTP Programs) Students choosing JS combo (Japanese Bridge Engineer) have to pass JPD133

details.description: The enterprise evaluates students' Professional knowledge and skills based on the form of FPT University.

Topic from video lectures, class discussion activities. Students discuss on group then present.

assessment_plan.grading_guide: Guided by instructor. Average point evaluated at the end of the semester.

details.description: Form groups (4-6 students, mixed majors), assign roles (CEO, CTO, CMO...). Find startup idea, name group, present business area.

assessment_plan.note: Instructor reviews the group's checkpoint 1 after grading.

details.description: Identify problem, analyze market (survey >100 people or 2 experts). Present market research, value proposition, market fit, competitor analysis.

assessment_plan.note: Instructor reviews the group's checkpoint 2 after grading.

details.description: Product/service description, Technology tools description, Canvas business model presentation.

assessment_plan.note: Instructor reviews the group's checkpoint 3 after grading.

details.description: Build a preliminary pitch deck. Criteria: Team profile (10%), Product market fit (40%), Business model (20%), Operative (20%), Fundraising plan (10%).

assessment_plan.note: Students can submit funding estimation for university support. Instructor reviews checkpoint 4 after grading.

assessment_plan.category: Final written thesis by evaluation commitee

details.description: Combination of all relevant major requirement, academic writing skills with required format. Marked by each of board's members based on rubrics.

assessment_plan.grading_guide: Average of board members mark. Mark given to project group.

details.description: Presentation of the startup project. Language: English.
details.knowledge_and_skill: Combination of all relevant acquired knowledge, project feasibility and presentation skills

assessment_plan.grading_guide: Average of board members mark. Mark given to each student individually.

details.description: Report 1 (Intro): 4%; Report 2 (PM Plan): 8%; Report 3 (Requirement): 16%; Report 4 (Design): 18%; Report 5 (Testing): 18%; Report 6 (User Guides): 4%; Report 7 (Implementation): 32%.

assessment_plan.note: Fail conditions before defense: (1) < 75% use cases/screens completed or < 20 average transactions; (2) Can't prove authorship; (3) > 3 obvious coding-logic defects OR > 1 show-stopper defects.

details.description: Thesis Defense Assessment (TDA): Intro (5%), PM Plan (5%), Requirement (15%), Design (10%), Testing (10%), User Guides (5%), Implementation (35%), Presentation Skills (5%), Q&A (10%).

assessment_plan.grading_guide: Personal mark is the average of all marks given by members of defence committee.
assessment_plan.note: Fail conditions after defense: (1) Can't demonstrate function/use case; (2) Can't prove authorship; (3) Critical defects. Student fails if OGA < 5 or cheating found.
